alert.note: Alert for Sebastian (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:01AM CDT until July 14 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN AND SEBASTIAN COUNTIES... At 400 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles north of Charleston to 2 miles southwest of Burnville to near Midland, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Charleston... Greenwood... Barling... Lavaca... Hackett... Huntington... Bonanza... Branch... Midland... Excelsior... Bloomer... Washburn... Burnville... Fort Chaffee... Jenny Lind... Central City... Arkola... Crossroads... Witcherville... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
